content:
@Chris Moesel - can the inclusion of input/ignoreWarnings.txt be made optional for an IG project? To the best of my knowledge, it isn't required by the IG publisher, but every IG that's created by SUSHI includes the following, causing an error during the IG build:

      {
        "extension": [
          {
            "url": "code",
            "valueString": "path-suppressed-warnings"
          },
          {
            "url": "value",
            "valueString": "input/ignoreWarnings.txt"
          }
        ],
        "url": "http://hl7.org/fhir/tools/StructureDefinition/ig-parameter"
      }
the IG that SUSHI creates for my projects doesn't have that parameter in it, so I'm not so sure that SUSHI is doing that.
yeah, that is being added by the IG Publisher itself and not by SUSHI
That's what I was about to say. SUSHI does not add that. I expect it is probably added by the templates -- so it is outside of SUSHI's control.
templates for sure - IG publisher itself doesn't do it

(Totally hijacking the thread... I find the changes that the templates do to the IG odd. It confuses the usefulness of the IG as a resource you might have on your server, with something used to generate the IG publication. My personal expectation had been that is that if a parameter (or any part of the IG resource) isn't something that is useful to downstream consumers, it doesn't belong in the resource. But I was recently surprised by all the temporarily-useful parameter values put into the resource.)
a reasonable issue - but something to take up somewhere else - maybe #IG creation
